tit.e: Shunkyo-den Hall (a building in Imperial Palace)

sen.j: 春興殿（しゅんこうでん、しゅんきょうでん）は、平安京内裏十七殿の一。
sen.e: Shunkyo-den Hall was one of 17 halls in Imperial Palace in the Heian-kyo capital.
Shunkyoden Hall was one of the 17 halls of the dairi (Imperial Palace) in the city of Heian-kyo.
sen.cmt: ・「Shunkyo-den」→「Shunkyoden」・「the」を追加・「in」→「of the」・「Heian-kyo capital」→「city of Heian-kyo」
sen.e: Shunkyoden（Syunkoden) Hall was one of the 17 halls of the dairi (Imperial Palace) in the city of Heian-kyo.
sen.cmt: 「しゅんこうでん」の読みも追加

sen.j: 紫宸殿の南東、日華門の南にあり、西の安福殿と大庭をへだてて相対する。
sen.e: Located in the southeast of Shishin-den Hall and in the south of Nikka-mon Gate, this hall faced Anpuku-den Hall in the west through a large garden.
Situated to the southeast of Shishinden Hall (Throne Hall) and to the south of Nikka-mon Gate, this hall faced Anpukuden Hall in the west across a large garden.
sen.cmt: ・「Located in」→「Situated to」・「Shishin-den Hall」→「Shishinden Hall (Throne Hall)」・「in」→「to」・「Anpuku-den」→「Anpukuden」・「through」→「across」
sen.e: Situated to the southeast of Shishinden Hall (Throne Hall) and to the south of Nikka-mon Gate, this hall faced Anpukuden Hall in the west across a large garden.
Arms were kept there.
It was used to store weapons and armor.
It was used to store weapons and armor.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代、神鏡を置き、内侍所（賢所）ともなる。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, the divine mirror was placed here, becoming Naishidokoro (or kashikodokoro) (the place where the divine mirror is enshrined).
During the Kamakura period, the sacred mirror was housed in this hall and it became the Naishidokoro (or Kashikodokoro; place where sacred mirror is enshrined).
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: During the Kamakura period, the sacred mirror was housed in this hall and it became the Naishidokoro (or Kashikodokoro; place where sacred mirror is enshrined).

sen.j: 身舎は東西2間、南北7間、北廂は東西2間、南北1間、東廂は東西1間、南北8間、東の孫廂は東西1間、南北6間である。
sen.e: The size of the main part of the hall was 3.6 meters in the east-west direction and 12.6 meters in the north-south direction, that of the room attached to its north side 3.6 meters in the east-west direction and 1.8 meters in the north-south direction, that of the room attached to its east side 1.8 meters in the east-west direction and 14.4 meters in the north-south direction, and another room further attached to the last-mentioned room 1.8 meters in the east-west direction and 10.8 meters in the north-south direction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The central area of the hall measured 3.6m east-west by 12.6m north-south, the kitabisashi (northern outer area) measured 3.6m east-west by 1.8m north-south, the higashibisashi (eastern outer area) measured 1.8m east-west by 14.4m north-south, and the eastern magohisashi (a narrow additional aisle) measured 1.8m east-west by 10.8m north-south.

The central area of the hall measured 3.6m east-west by 12.6m north-south, the kitabisashi (northern outer area) measured 3.6m east-west by 1.8m north-south, the higashibisashi (eastern outer area) measured 1.8m east-west by 14.4m north-south, and the eastern magohisashi (a narrow additional aisle) measured 1.8m east-west by 10.8m north-south.

sen.j: その南の方東西1間、南北2間は東、南が塀に囲まれる。
sen.e: The 1.8-meter portion on the south side of the last 1.8 x 10.8-meters room and the southernmost 3.6-meter portion on the east side of the same room was surrounded by a wall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The 1.8m portion on the south side of the last 1.8 x 10.8m room and the southernmost 3.6m portion on the east side of the same room were surrounded by a wall.
The 1.8m portion on the south side of the last 1.8 x 10.8m room and the southernmost 3.6m portion on the east side of the same room were surrounded by a wall.

sen.j: 南面中央に1間四方の廂であると思われる所がある。
sen.e: In the center on the south side of the main part of this hall, there was a place supposed to be a room of a 1.8 meter square.
In the center of the south side of the main part of this hall was an outer area that is thought to have measured 1.8 square meters.
sen.cmt: ・「on」→「of」・文の後半をナチュラルに再翻訳
sen.e: In the center of the south side of the main part of this hall was an outer area that is thought to have measured 1.8 square meters.

sen.j: 身舎の西面、北、および南からの第二の間に戸口がある。
sen.e: A door is provided on the west side of the main part of the hall, and a door is also provided for entering the second room from the north and for entering the same room from the south.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処この文章、特に”第二の間”の意味が理解しかねましたので、字句どおりに訳してあります。
sen.e: There were doorways on the west and north faces of the central area as well as a doorway on the south face used to access the secondary room.
There were doorways on the west and north faces of the central area as well as a doorway on the south face used to access the secondary room.
Eaves were provided in front of each of these doors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A tsuchibisashi (a pent roof with its under-structure exposed that extends above a hard-packed earthen floor) was located in front of each of these.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように再翻訳
sen.e: A tsuchibisashi (a pent roof with its under-structure exposed that extends above a hard-packed earthen floor) was located in front of each of these.

sen.j: 里内裏の春興殿は日華門の北、内侍所を奉安としたという。
sen.e: It is said that, when Shunkyo-den Hall was used as satodairi (a temporary palace), Naishidokoro placed in the north of Nikamon was moved here.
It is said that the Naishidokoro located to the north of Nikka-mon Gate was moved here when Shunkyoden Hall was used as a satodairi (a temporary palace),
sen.cmt: ・「the」を追加・「placed」→「located」・「in」→「to」・「Nikamon」→「Nika-mon Gate」・「Shunkyo-den」→「Shunkyoden」・「a」を追加
sen.e: It is said that the Naishidokoro located to the north of Nikka-mon Gate was moved here when Shunkyoden Hall was used as a satodairi (a temporary palace),

sen.j: 現在の京都御所にも同名の殿舎がある。
sen.e: A hall with the same name exists in the present Kyoto Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A hall with the same name exists in the present Kyoto Imperial Palace.
A hall with the same name exists in the present Kyoto Imperial Palace.

sen.j: しかしながら、平安時代の頃の春興殿とは、位置関係が異なる場所に建てられている。
sen.e: However, its location is different from that of Shunkyo-den Hall in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
